thread.section_title: KWCH | Local News, Weather, Sports | Wichita, KS
thread.title: Salina slammed with storm damage

author: @KWCH12
title: Salina slammed with storm damage
text:
WICHITA, Kan. (KWCH) - Kansans are cleaning up damage from severe storms that blew through the state late Wednesday night.
Autoplay Those storms brought 95 mph winds to Salina, uprooting trees and power poles, blowing over stoplights and ripping the roofs off buildings.
Due to the extensive damage, the Saline County Commission issued a verbal state of disaster emergency proclamation. County and City officials are providing recovery services for all Saline County residents, including free meals, cooling centers and charging stations, and debris cleanup assistance.
Those cooling centers and charging stations are necessary because thousands of Salina residents were without power after the storm. According to Evergy, dozens of power poles were knocked down, and multiple transmission lines were damaged.
Evergy said most repairs will be completed by Thursday night, but some outages are expected to stretch into Saturday afternoon. Linemen from surrounding states are being called in to assist with these repairs.
According to the Kansas Highway Patrol, the storm also caused a semi-truck to overturn on its side on northbound Interstate 135 at the Kansas Highway 140 junction. One of the two men inside was taken to the hospital with a possible injury.
The City of Salina said staff across multiple departments will perform a city-wide limb pick-up in the next several days in order to make the roads passable.
